Politikus Golkar Khawatir Partainya Punah Seperti Dinosaurus
04 Nov 2019, 03:56 by Budiarti Utami Putri, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Politikus senior Partai Golkar Agun Gunandjar Sudarsa mengaku khawatir dengan dinamika internal partainya menjelang musyawarah nasional Desember mendatang. Agun menilai dua calon ketua umum yang ada, Airlangga Hartarto dan Bambang Soesatyo, bertarung dengan pragmatis belaka.
Agun pun menganggap dua calon tersebut seperti tak memiliki gagasan mengembalikan Golkar sebagai partai ide dan partai kader. Jika kondisi itu terus berlanjut, kata Agun, dia khawatir Golkar terpuruk di pemilu 2024.
"Jangan sampai tercatat di 2024 Golkar makin terpuruk. Saya identikkan jadi seperti dinosaurus, punah," kata Agun kepada Tempo, akhir pekan lalu.
Menurut Agun, Golkar terpuruk jika perolehan suaranya anjlok ke urutan kelima atau keenam dari yang sebelumnya pernah menjadi pemenang pemilu. Agun juga mengungkit perolehan suara Golkar yang terus turun sejak Pemilu 2004.
Pada pemilihan legislatif 2004, Golkar meraih 21,58 persen suara dan 128 kursi di Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat. Angka ini terus turun menjadi 14,45 persen (107 kursi) di pileg 2009, kemudian 14,75 persen (91 kursi) di pileg 2014, dan 12,31 persen (85 kursi) di pileg 2019.
"Saya belum memiliki optimisme di 2024 Golkar maju di bawah dua orang ini. Apakah bisa dalam lima tahun merancang Golkar kembali sebagai partai ide," kata anggota Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat enam periode ini.
Agun menilai kepemimpinan Ketua Umum Golkar Airlangga Hartarto hari ini belum menunjukkan wajah Golkar sebagai partai ide. Dia mencontohkan, di bawah Aburizal Bakrie sebelumnya Golkar kerap merespons serta mengkritik kebijakan pemerintah secara resmi.
Agun pun mengakui Airlangga berada dalam posisi sulit lantaran Golkar mendukung pemerintahan Presiden Joko Widodo. "Justru itulah saya tidak yakin dia mampu menjalankan lima tahun ke depan ketika dia memegang posisi Menko (Perekonomian) dan ketum partai," kata dia.
Di sisi lain, Agun juga menilai Bambang Soesatyo juga memiliki sejumlah catatan. Apalagi Bamsoet saat ini juga sudah menjabat sebagai ketua Majelis Permusyawaratan Rakyat.

Golkar Politicians Worry Their Party Extincts Like Dinosaurs
04 Nov 2019, 03:56 by Budiarti Utami Putri, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Senior Golkar Party politician Agun Gunandjar Sudarsa said he was worried about the internal dynamics of his party ahead of the national conference in December. Agun assesses the two existing candidates for chairman, Airlangga Hartarto and Bambang Soesatyo, to fight with mere pragmatics.
Agun also considers the two candidates as having no idea to return Golkar as an idea party and a cadre party. If these conditions continue, said Agun, he is worried that Golkar will suffer in the 2024 election.
"Do not let it be recorded that in 2024 Golkar has gotten worse. I have identified it as becoming a dinosaur, extinct," Agun told Tempo last weekend.
According to Agun, Golkar would suffer if its vote fell to fifth or sixth from the previous election winner. Agun also brought up the vote for Golkar which has continued to fall since the 2004 elections.
In the 2004 legislative elections, Golkar won 21.58 percent of the votes and 128 seats in the House of Representatives. This figure continues to fall to 14.45 percent (107 seats) in the 2009 legislative elections, then 14.75 percent (91 seats) in the 2014 legislative elections, and 12.31 percent (85 seats) in the 2019 legislative elections.
"I do not yet have optimism that in 2024 Golkar will advance under these two people. Will it be possible to design Golkar again in five years as an idea party," said the six-member House of Representatives.
Agun assessed that the leadership of Golkar Chairperson Airlangga Hartarto today has not shown the face of Golkar as an idea party. He gave an example, under the previous Aburizal Bakrie, Golkar had often responded and criticized official government policies.
Agun also admitted that Airlangga was in a difficult position because Golkar supported the government of President Joko Widodo. "That is precisely why I am not sure he will be able to run the next five years when he holds the position of Coordinating Minister (Economy) and party chairperson," he said.
On the other hand, Agun also considered that Bambang Soesatyo also had a number of notes. Moreover, Bamsoet currently also serves as chairman of the People's Consultative Assembly.
